ovdesc.p: This file allows the user to request particular PM Reports.

These reports can either be produced online by running this application using the 'V' (verify) function or as part of the end of day run. For the end of day run a request must have been entered onto this file and the record ID included in the data field of the Batch record for Position management reports. The Batch process record is EOD.PM.REPORTS and is run as part of the start of day processing when the Position management files have been updated by all of the overnight processing.
At present the following types of reports can be produced - Cash Flow report. Gap position report. Interest Sensitivity Report.
The headings on these reports can be changed by modifying the following Static Text records - For Cash flow report. For Gap position report. For Interest Sensitivity Report.

desc.p: It will not be possible to update both the CALENDAR field and the CONSOL.PERIOD field. The default consolidation method will be daily if the CONSOL.PERIOD and CALENDAR fields are left bank.
The following values can be input.
D (or null) data will be consolidated on a daily basis.
M data will be consolidated by calendar month
Q data will be consolidated by calendar quarter
S data will be consolidated on a semi-annual basis
A data will be consolidated on an annual basis

Indicates at which point in the calendar record the time periods are to start from in the report.

On a report there is a line for each time period. The time periods are taken from the appropriate record on the PM.CALENDAR file. This field contains the period from which reporting is to start, thus allowing reporting to start from Spot date rather than Calendar date.

1 to 11 alphanumreic characters (Mandatory input) Must be one of the following - Value Meaning CAL Today (Call). TOM Next Working day (Tomorrow). SPT Two working days from Today (Spot). nnD Number of Calendar Days from Spot date. nnW Number of Weeks from Spot date. nnM Number of Months from Spot date. nnY Number of Years from Spot date. * Remainder that is anything after last time period. Note in the above nn equals 01 - 99.

Defines the PM report to be printed, there is a specific range of reports see below.
Each of the reports has been given a 'name' and it is that name that must be entered in this field. The valid names are -
CASH.FLOW GAP GAP2 INTEREST.SENSITIVITY
A brief description of each report is given.

CASH.FLOW - This report shows amounts only and has the following columns - Time period/Date. Outgoing Funds (Takings maturing) Incoming Funds (Placings maturing) Net Difference. Cumulative Balance. GAP - This report gives details of balances and interest rates and has the following columns - Time period/Date. Takings maturing principal. Takings average interest rate. Placings maturing principal. Placings average interest rate. Net Difference principal. Break even rate (this is the rate at which the net difference must be lent or borrowed to breakeven i.e to not make a loss or a profit). Cumulative Balance. This cumulative amount starts from the first time period and works towards the last time period. Such that the cumulative amount for the last time is equal to the total outstanding amount.

GAP2 - This report gives details of balances and interest rates and has the following columns - Time period/Date. Takings maturing principal. Takings average interest rate. Placings maturing principal. Placings average interest rate. Net Difference principal. Break even rate (this is the rate at which the net difference must be lent or borrowed to breakeven i.e not make a loss or profit). Cumulative Balance. This cumulative amount is the total amount outstanding at that period. This means that for the first time period the cumultaive amount is equal to the total of the Net difference principal column (total outstanding amount).

INTEREST.SENSITIVITY. This report has the following columns - Time period/Date. Average No of Days for outstanding takings. Average No of Days for outstanding placings. Absolute Difference in the average days. Net principal position for the period.
The effect of increase in the interest rates by following percentages - .25% .50% .75% 1% 2% 3%
One of the allowed report names - CASH.FLOW, GAP, GAP2 or INTEREST.SENSITIVITY (Mandatory input)

Indicates, when producing a combined report, which company consolidation group to use.

When producing a report which is to cover more than one company, there is the need to know which companies are to be included. The records on the file COMPANY.CONSOL contain details about the different company consolidations. Thus in this field is entered the key of the COMPANY.CONSOL record that covers the consolidation required.
3 numreic characters (Optional input) Must be a valid record on the COMPANY.CONSOL file.

Defines whether for the time breaks the date or the period is to be printed.
The first column on the reports is the time break. This can be printed as either a DATE e.g 16APR92, 21APR92, 22APR92 etc or a PERIOD e.g CAL, TOM, SPT etc.
Either DATE or PERIOD. (Mandatory input)
